frameDefinitions: In this frame an Offense is described in terms of the legal or other punishing action that can be taken in response to the offense. '
A Judge refrains from imposing, or demanding a punishment for an Evaluee who has committed an Offense.
An Authority excuses an Offense that an Offender has committed, with the effect of ending or preventing any punishment.
An Event continues at a certain Place through Time.
An Executive_authority exercises their power to reduce or remove negative consequences for someone who has been labeled an Offender who participated in an Crime.
An Agent has committed a Wrong in the past and is making Amends for it.
frameExamples: President Ford <t>pardoned</t> her after it came to light she was being held in Japan as an 'enemy alien' and was secretly working to subvert the broadcasts DNI
Pyongyang agreed to suspend its withdrawal while talks <t>continued</t> with Washington.

A Fort Worth man convicted of a robbery his brother later confessed
to committing was granted <t>clemency</t> on December 20, 2002, by Governor Rick Perry.
He <t>atoned</t> for his sin with good works.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Offense</fen> is the action, crime, or event which is described in terms of what legal or punishing action can be taken against the offender.
The <fen>Judge</fen> holds the <fen>Evaluee</fen> responsible for the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is subject to the judgment of the <fen>Judge</fen> for having committed the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Offense</fen> is the illicit or unpleasant act committed by the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
This role denotes the offender that seeks or gets the pardon.
Authority is the organization or person taht grants the pardon.
This role denotes the the illegal act that the <fen>Offender</fen> is pardoned for.
This role denotes the time when the pardon is given
The location at which the pardoning takes place.
Name of the <fen>Event</fen> which is continuing.
When the <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
Where the <fen>Event</fen> takes place.
The individual who is accused or convicted of a <fen>Crime</fen>.
An action deemed criminal by law.
The constitutionally specified authority who has the power to grant clemency.
The time at which clemency is granted.
The location at which the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> grants clemency.
The <fen>Agent</fen> has committed a <fen>Wrong</fen> and is making <fen>Amends</fen>.
<fen>Wrong</fen> identifies the act committed by the <fen>Agent</fen> for which <fen>Amends</fen> are made.
<fen>Amends</fen> marks expressions that indicate what the <fen>Agent</fen> does to compensate for the <fen>Wrong</fen> that was committed.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> atones for the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> expiates the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Won't you forgive me <fex>for keeping it a secret</fex>?
Defense minister Ivanov rules out pardon <fex>for Chechen rebel leader Maskhadov</fex>.
<fex>The governement</fex> issued a pardon to the two convicts.
They demanded a pardon to John <fex>for inadverdent manslaughter</fex>.
The families demanded a <fex>posthumous</fex> pardon for the executed soldiers.

On 1 March 2002, Andreyev was found guilty of libel and conditionally sentenced
to two years in prison and then pardoned <fex>in the courtroom</fex>.

Since 1976, <fex>225 death row inmates</fex> have been granted clemency for humanitarian
reasons.
I never saw a legal case where a person was given clemency <fex>for murder</fex>.
Mr. Papa was granted clemency for a drug conviction <fex>by Mr. Pataki</fex>, and released in 1997

In addition to Ms.  White, 55, Mr.  Pataki granted clemency <fex>yesterday</fex> to three men serving long prison terms for offenses under the stern Rockefeller-era drug laws that mandate long sentences for some relatively low-level drug crimes.
Apparently, no woman has ever been granted clemency <fex>there</fex>.
<fex>Syria</fex> has atoned for its support of Iraq.
Smithers is atoning <fex>for his misspent youth</fex>.
He atoned for his sin <fex>with good works</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Gay and Lesbian Association of Ghana
the Gay and Lesbian Association of Ghana
